intro: Pentaphragma integrifolium, commonly known as the smoothleaf bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its simple, entire leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that typically bloom in early summer. The plant is often found in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds and ditches. It possesses a unique ability to trap small aquatic organisms, which it uses as a source of nutrients. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it a common sight in wetland environments.
